column1:
Guess I'm a little early. Maybe I'll just keep
working on the...

Whoa, speak of the devil. Uh... Well, you guys
got here quick.
I thought we were gonna die...

I think we already did... My soul's barely
tethered to my body.

My apologies, Haru, but I request you steer
clear of the driver's seat from now on. I only
have so many lives left...
Um... I was just driving normally... I think.
Whew... The room finally stopped spinning.

You have a very, uh, "unique" way of driving,
Haru.
She really shouldn't take it as a compliment...

Regardless, I'm glad you guys made it here in
one piece.

By the way, what is this place? It seems unfit for
a typical gathering of law enforcement.

You could call it my secret base, I guess.
Basically, it's a place to hole up if shit
ever goes south.
A good friend of mine used to run it.

But now it's just an empty old bar, suitable for
investigating far away from any prying eyes.
So this is like your hideout.
More like a safe room— No, a safe house!

Those newspapers... Are they not from two years
prior?

Those newspapers are irrelevant. We have
other business to discuss here.
All right. Let me break it down for you bit by bit.

I cross-referenced every name on the list we
found in Okinawa.

Based on our assumption that the mastermind
would stand to benefit from changing hearts
en masse...
This is who we ended up with.
Yeah... He sure looks like a schemey bastard.

Don't I know it... To think he'd turn up now
of all times...

Anyway, the man's name is Jyun Owada. At 69
years old, he's on his tenth term as a legislator.

Not only that, but he worked his way up to
Chief Cabinet Secretary of the ruling party.
In short, he's not someone to mess with.

They say he was a Masayoshi Shido supporter
during the election last year.

Unbelievable... I never thought I'd hear his
name again.
Yeah, and one HELL of an evil asshole.

Man, he totally tried to screw up your entire
life... I get why you'd wanna block him out.

Sounds like you and Shido had quite the
history. But we're not after him right now.

That list contained a handful of Owada's
political opponents—people he'd rather
not have around.
So it's clear he's behind all this.

However, I highly doubt he's doing his own
dirty work. He'd have a heck of a time getting
his political opponents to friend him on EMMA.

After checking his inner circle for sympathizers,
I found out he's been meeting with a certain
entrepreneur. Quite often, too.

Nice guess. It's the CEO of Madicce all right:
Akira Konoe.

I told you, he's not our guy. It's the CEO of
Madicce: Akira Konoe.

Are you tryin' to piss me off? Look, it's the CEO
of Madicce: Akira Konoe.

Isn't the CEO of Madicce the guy we heard 
speak back in Sendai?

I came across communication records between
him and the director at Okinawa... and it
showed they kept in contact.

Whenever Owada wants someone out of his
way, he calls on Konoe to take action...
And the director at Okinawa was likely the one who arranged this. Now, it's too late to tell.

Hold on. If Konoe's the one changing hearts,
does that make him a Monarch too?

But he's the CEO of Madicce. Wouldn't he get
one of his subordinates to do the job for him?
I suppose it would be natural to assume that.

But as you all know, in order to change
someone's heart, you need to be their
friend on EMMA.

Everyone Owada associates with is a big-time
elite. And Konoe's the only one in their league.

Besides, he's the head of a huge company.
If anything, I think he'd want to be a Monarch
as well.

He wouldn't want to risk his heart getting
changed by someone else, either.

Another thing. The people on that list most
likely had their hearts changed in Osaka.
Huh? Why do you say that?

Everyone on that list who went crazy had
all traveled to Osaka at some point.
That's also where Madicce's main office is.

Meaning there's a good chance we'll find
a Jail in Osaka... with Konoe as its Monarch.

Though, the only way we'll know for sure
is if Sophia senses it.

Oh, right, we did pass through Osaka when I
took a wrong turn.

I did speak up. But you guys were too busy
to listen.
If it was when Haru was driving...

Then we were likely too busy screaming
for our lives...

Well, that certainly makes things easier.
So it's confirmed there's a Jail in Osaka.

Now we just need to determine whether
Konoe's the Monarch or not.

Wait, if you know that much already, why not
cuff his ass right now!?

That list only spells out his motives and
connections. It isn't solid proof that
he's been changing hearts.

We can't arrest him on speculation alone.
The most we can do is conduct a search,
and that's only with his consent.

Hell, he could pack up and run if he wanted to.
We don't have any legal authority over him.

Another thing I noticed is how many high-
ranking members of the force were on that list.

You think he's changed their hearts too?
To get the police in his pocket?

Yeah, and from the look of it, not just the
rank-and-file, either.

So that's why you called us here... Because you
don't know who the real enemies are.

The most I can do without being traced is some
light investigation. And even then, that might be
impossible.

If it's the top brass we're dealing with, they
might just leak the info and take action before I
can lift a finger.
In other words, the police are not our allies.
...You do realize I'm also a man in uniform?

Anyway, it's obvious that going about this the
regular way is out of the question.

What we need is something a bit more
uncanny... Something only you guys are
capable of.
You want us to change his heart?
You want us to torture him?
You want us to kidnap him?

Right. If Konoe really is a Monarch, we can
corner him into a confession.

Come on, I can do that on my own— Wait, like
hell I can! That's illegal!

If our hunch is right, and he really is the
Monarch, we can grab a confession out of him!

That's right. We completely overlooked the
fact that Konoe has a Jail.
But won't we need a keyword to gain access?
Precisely why I had you rush over here.

I'll be meeting Konoe at Madicce's
corporate headquarters today.

By going about it like a cop. Told 'em we had
intel about a possible security leak involving
their software.

"We received information about a possible
party attempting to hack EMMA," so on and
so forth.
Ooh, does somebody need a hacker?

Not even that. I only said it to score me an
appointment.

At the end of it, I'll suggest he add me on EMMA
so I can answer any further questions, and we'll
have ourselves a keyword.

In his mind, I'll be just another pawn for the
taking. So I'm pretty sure he'll take the bait.

The moment I get the keyword—if I get the
keyword—I'll send it right over.

That's what I've been meaning to tell you.
Hope it was worth the drive.

Wait, if you're gonna hit up their office, that
means you're goin' to Osaka, right? Let us
come with.

The sooner we enter the Jail, the sooner we can
finish this operation.

Fair, but there's a chance I might not get the
keyword. Tagging along for nothing would
be a wasted effort.

Besides, doesn't Niijima need a breather?
In fact, you all look like you need one.

Bottom line is, if you guys go down,
so does everything I've worked for.
So I need you fighting at your best.
Got it. So our job's to wait until further contact.
What the hell, now we gotta wait even more?

Oh? You really wanna complain, right when I'm
about to tell you the big surprise I have in store
for you?
